stories.text:
presuming that you have on the table two offers: one for fullstack .net (C# + angular, react or blazor) and one for ios developer. the interesting part is that both are almost identical (salary, office, benefits etc.)

an advice will be very welcome - what will you choose and why?

p.s. my background is mostly backend in golang (so the technology switch should be done anyway). and yes - I googled it but decided to ask here so that search engines bubble filters can be excluded..

p.s.s. I'm fine with both ones (maybe a little more inclined to choose ios). But interested also in your opinion about eventual perspective (looking into the future) related to chosen path.
stories.title: Carieer path advice: .NET vs. iOS
How we migrated entirely to CSS Modules

stories.text:
Obviously this will very wildly, but it seems like something has changed in this landscape over the last 5-10 years. It used to be common knowledge that founders/founding engineers would take a measly salary in exchange for significant equity.

But some recent anecdata has me questioning if this is true anymore (seeing $200k+ salary plus equity in some cases).

So, anybody have any insight? What's the market like for experienced founding/early engineers right now?
stories.title: Ask HN: What are founding engineers getting paid?
What Happened to the Dream of Private Cryptocurrency?
